body.p:
State of Kentucky Taylor County
To His Excellency
Gov.r Bramlett

Your Petitioner Richard Wright humbly states, that by Judgment of the Taylor Circuit Court rendered its March Term 1864. he was find $114,, and Imprisoned in the County Jail ten months on the Trial of an Indictment for assault.

That he did not, & could not attend the trial owing to the fact ^of the troubles of the Country & guerillas &^ that his life had been threatened by bad men who would have taken his life, or done him great bodily harm if he had attempted to attend the trial. If he could have attended the trial he could have made defense & shown his innosence. And in his absence owing to the facts above stated and the prejudicial statements of witnesses the Judgt was obtaind against him, He is a very poor man and his Eight small & helpless children depending upon his own manual labor for their only support. Wherefore he asks that he pardoned & released from the Imprisonment & that the fine be remited Except fees & cost which will be a very heavy fine on him under the circumstances.
subscribed & sworn to before me by Richard Wright on this 19th day of October 1865
Thomas M Wright J P T C

we the undersigned citizens of Taylor County believe the statement made in the Petition of Richard Wright, and believe he deserves Executive Clemency & ask the Governor to release him from the penalty of the Imprisonment & remit his fine except fees & costs.

Jas Jones
C B Beams
C underwood
J. N Turner
P. L. Netherland
Rd Seter
Thos R. Wright Clk Cir Court
A J Gowdy
J. R. Robinson

We the Jury who tried the case of Richard Wright named in his Petition now think he deserves Executive clemency & ask the Governor to Pardon & Release said Wright form his Imprisonment & fine except fees & costs.

W. H. Cowherd
P Saunders
Wm Meese
EDmond Bunnice
William T. Stuble
